questions.question: Which UNESCO site is known as the birthplace of the industrial revolution, home to the world's first factory founded in 1771?
questions.context: This site showcases historic cotton factories that significantly contributed to technological and industrial advancements during the 18th and 19th centuries.

questions.question: What modern architectural marvel features a world-record holding bridge opened in 1998, spanning a strait to connect two land masses?
questions.context: This combined railway and motorway bridge is notable for its design and engineering, linking Sweden and Denmark across the Øresund strait.

questions.question: At which historical battle site did the famous charge of the Light Brigade take place during the Crimean War in 1854?
questions.context: This battle is remembered for the ill-fated and valiant cavalry charge, now immortalized in Alfred Lord Tennyson's poem.

questions.question: Which famous museum, opened in 1793, was formerly a royal palace and is home to the Mona Lisa?
questions.context: As the world's largest art museum, it houses thousands of works across diverse periods and cultures, attracting millions of visitors annually.

questions.question: What ancient ruin, located in southeastern Turkey, is one of the oldest known temples dating back to the Pre-Pottery Neolithic period around 9600 BC?
questions.context: This archaeological site is notable for its large stone pillars arranged in circles and provides insight into early human settlement.
